Reviews.Title: “Seeking rest and recreation”
Reviews.Author: abdulaziz o
Reviews.Content: Ù�Ù†Ø¯Ù‚ Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ø¹ Ø¨Ø­Ù‚ Ø®Ù…Ø³Ø© Ù†Ø¬ÙˆÙ… Ø®Ø¯Ù…Ø© Ù…Ù…ØªØ§Ø²Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø¹Ø± Ù…Ù†Ø§Ø³Ø¨ Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ø¨Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù…Ø© Ø³Ø±Ø¹Ø© Ù�ÙŠ Ø¥Ø¬Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ø§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ø®ÙˆÙ„ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø®Ø±ÙˆØ¬ Ù…Ù†Ø¶Ø± Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ø¹ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¯ÙˆØ§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„ÙŠØ§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø³Ù�ÙˆØ± Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù�Ø·Ø§Ø± Ø¨ÙˆÙ�ÙŠØ© Ù…Ù�ØªÙˆØ­ Ù…Ù†ÙˆØ¹ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø¶Ø§Ù�Ø© Ø¨ÙˆÙ�ÙŠØ© Ø®Ø§Øµ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¯ÙˆØ§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙƒØ³ÙƒÙŠÙˆØ²Ù� Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø¨Ø§ Ù…Ù…ØªØ§Ø² . Ø¹ÙŠØ¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ­ÙŠØ¯ Ø£Ù† Ù…ÙˆÙ‚Ø¹Ø© Ø¨Ø¹ÙŠØ¯ Ø¬Ø¯Ø§ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø³Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆØ±Ø¨ÙŠ Ù„Ø£Ø³Ø·Ù†Ø¨ÙˆÙ„ Ø£ÙˆØµÙŠ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¨Ø´Ø¯Ø© Ù„Ù…Ù† ÙŠÙ†Ø´Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø§Ø­Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£Ø³ØªØ¬Ù…Ø§Ù… Ø¥Ø·Ù„Ø§Ù„Ø© Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ø¹Ø© Ù…Ù† Fabulous hotel with five-star service right excellent price suitable for Price rapidly in agraeat entry and exit . Overview fantastic from upper floors on Bosphorus breakfast buffet as well as a varied buffet special roles alakskiozv Spa is excellent The onlydrawback that location far from the European section of Istanbul strongly recommended for those Seeking rest and recreation

Reviews.Title: “good choice for business in asia side of Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: ozlem-burak
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Divan Ä°stanbul Asia for two nights for a business trip in the shipyards area in Tuzla. It is a very comfortable hotel, the rooms are very well decorated, the bathroom is beautiful and people were nice generally. There was a pillow menu where you can choose the most appropriate type of pillow for your self. The breakfast is very good with lots of variety and there is a roof restaurant where the food is delicious. The location is just next to the highway, which has both pros and cons as you may guess. It is not very close to attractive parts of Istanbul but if you have a business to do close by, it is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business!”
Reviews.Author: ModernistItaly
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for a week 3 Jan 2012 - 10 Jan 2012. Room is fantastic, Bed is just so comfortable. The first night i ate on the Top Floor restaurant, (Just a little too formal for me) afterwards i ate in the lobby Restaurant and Bar, a lot more relaxed and illuminated. I have noticed a lot of people stating that there is nothing close by, how ever this is not entirely true, come out of the Hotel, turn left and then left again you will find shops, a couple of restaurants etc. Also regarding lack of wifi in the rooms, if you have a laptop you can create your own Wifi network for your Ipads, phones etc. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. In fact i am due to return tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “My Istanbul Favourite”
Reviews.Author: PRasmus
Reviews.Content: Choose this fine Hotel. It's my Istanbul Favourite for sure. Not only is the interior wonderfull with classy ottoman style, the staff really makes and honest efford to make it work for you. Any practical problem can be solved with a smile. Nothing is missing in the hotel facilities. Rooms are spacious and cosy. On the top you'll find restaurant and top terrasse with a sunset view matching those at Bosporus. There's nothing to prevent you from having a nice stay here. Location close to the nearby Sabiha GÃ¶cken Airport makes it easy to reach, far away from the traffic jam in the center and on the bridges. Perfect when doing business on the asian side.

Reviews.Title: “very good... but..”
Reviews.Author: gonca-melih
Reviews.Content: it is a very good hotel, convenient for business trip ... there is nothing around the hotel building to entertain..the food served in hotel restaurant didnt satisfy my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive First Impression”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Salcedo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights during a business trip. I had never heard about this chain so I thought (as usually when someone arranges a hotel for you) "lets see what awaits me". Well I must say that I was very impressed by the high standards everywhere. Room: large, good taste, everything working, good choice in mini-bar in general good attention to detail. Only downside: no wi-fi, only cable internet. Spa: amazing. lots of things available and generous rooms for sauna, steam bath, etc Gym: again, amazing, huge variety of equipment (all TechnoGym new and in perfect state as of Dec 2011) Conference room: excellent, huge rooms with huge ceilings good acustic and good wifi (we delivered a training with about 30 laptops all surfing at the same time and speed was very decent) Food: to kill for. I tried the first evening the roof restaurant and had some amazing pieces of meat, the other days we had lunch in the Mezanine and the bufett was just glorious. I could really kill to have more of those Baklavas with pistache. In summary: an excellent hotel where the designers sat lots of hours and really gave it a though on how to make one's stay confortable, from the ease of use of the safe (which I use a lot and it was very quick to open and close) to the amazing service of all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maury h
Reviews.Content: Was there beginning of October for a partner event that took place there. Beautiful hotel, really classy and the staff was very friendly, need to mention though that the ones I dealt with did not all speak very well English. The room was top notch, modern and classy with a beautiful bathroom. The food they served us was also very good, international and turkish dishes alike. I have too add though that this hotel is on the asian side of Istanbul. The most interesting sights are on the european/modern side of Istanbul, where you will also find other nice hotels to stay at, even another Divan. It can take up to 40 minutes or even longer to get from this hotel to the other side. So if you do have a choice and don't have to be on the Asian side, then I recommend not to go to the Asian Side.

Reviews.Title: “Achieving a high hospitality standard”
Reviews.Author: Tamer H
Reviews.Content: Asian side of Istanbul has never been boasting of variety and quality of accomodation alternatives till three years ago. Only modest one-night hotels were available. Now it has changed, because one of the best hotels in Istanbul is giving service at Pendik, close to the airport. And believe me, this is not just a regular airport hotel; it adds value through an oriental ( but by no means exaggerated) gusto. The rooms are well equipped, spacious with lovely baths. If you have a chance try corner suites for just few EUR more. You have then wider view out of your window. Access to the hotel with a car may be a little difficult, because it is on the side road of the main road; try to access the side road correctly, otherwise you have to travel many miles forh and back.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel well placed for Sabiha Gokcen Airport”
Reviews.Author: Andyolly
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 1 night having driven up from Izmir, before flying out the next morning. The hotel has an imposing atrium, but the reception staff were friendly and helpful. We were upgraded as we needed an extra bed in one of the rooms, and our adjoining rooms on the 11th Floor had great views of the sea of Marmara. The beds were extremely comfortable, with a selection of pillows available. The bathrooms, with separate shower and large, deep bath were very good. As the hotel is not in a restaurant district, we opted for drinks on the 18th Floor to watch the sun go down and later returned for a very good meal with a very good glass of local wine. The shiraz is much better than the merlot! We enjoyed a relaxing, luxurious stay for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROMBAS
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good level of comfort. Welcome is well and price is acceptable. Quality of the cooking is perfect in International style. You can take your meal on the terrase on the top of the hotel. This hotel is equip with a good room for training with a confortable swiming pool. Room are confortable with adequate confort to stay several days. Internet link is free and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious, western-style business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessilynne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two non-consecutive nights at the Divan Asia in April 2011. We flew into Istanbul's Sabiha Gokcen Airport (SAW) and took the hotel's free shuttle. Our room was enormous, with a king sized bed, an entire pillow menu, a sitting area with a huge flat-screen TV, a large bathroom with both a tub and a standing shower, and floor to ceiling windows overlooking the water. The staff was courteous and helpful but never pushy. One night we ordered room service and the food was quite delicious and delivered on-time. One morning we ate at the breakfast buffet and was impressed with both the quantity and the quality of the food. The hotel is definitely designed for businessmen, however, and at breakfast I realized that I was the only female guest in the entire 200-person dining room. Another downside to being a business hotel is that the free airport shuttle doesn't run on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Wireless2000
Reviews.Content: Very high international standard hotel. Room (corner room) very spacious, almost to be considered junior suite. Bathroom also very large and well equipped. High standard material end to end. Very nice staff and great rooftop restaurant and bar. I was ewsxtremely satisfied. Also user their airport pickup which was great, the car was a few minutes late, but I was welcomed by one of their representatives who invited me to Starbucks for a complimentary coffee while I waited. I spoke to some regulars who assured me this was the best hotel by far on the Asian side of Istanbul. Obviously the locations is not good for visits to central Istanbul, and the area around the hotel is drab, but for business this is the right choice. Only addition would be Wi-Fi in the rooms, there is a ethernet cable but I like to work from the bed or couch. I don't mind paying for it (otherwise it is just included in the rate anyhow).

Reviews.Title: “Wow, and once again wow!”
Reviews.Author: Gabeszgabesz
Reviews.Content: When I entered this hotel, I felt like I'm at the wrong place. In a good way! Everything is so clean and elegant. My room was beyond expectations. Huge bathroom, with separate bathtub and shower, huge bed, giant LCD television (about 40 " !!). The free internet connection was something that can truly be called broadband (8-10 megabit/s DL speed!) The gym/spa area is also magnificent. The gym is equipped with all the latest Technogym machines, the staff is very friendly if you need any help. Next to it is the wellness area: steam room, sauna, jacuzzi, rain room (this was new to me), turkish bath, indorr swimming pool. The staff is cleaning up this area about every 15 minutes!!! Incredible! There is also an open-air pool with several sunbends. The food is quite good in the restaurant, but the choice is very limited. There is a big shopping mall right on the other side of the motorway, and it's easy to access by walking (about 10 mins). In overall: if you need to stay somewhere around Pendik (the name of the area where this hotel is located) this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations. Authentic Turkish hospitality in 5* class”
Reviews.Author: avilir
Reviews.Content: Even the Turkish coffee is smiling in Divan. Divan gave me Divine service. It started normally and got better every day. The staff got to know me and my habits. They remembered what I ordered before . "Turkish coffee with a little sugar sir?" . The greatness of service is sometimes in the finest details. My tooth paste was about to finish. I found next to it a new tooth paste. I thought this is really caring. Divan gave me the feeling of family and friends which is important in a foreign place. Another example of care was illustrated by the bellboy Ali. I was in a hurry for a meeting. It was raining and once the taxi came, the driver was not sure where the place is on the street. Not to lose time, Ali took his phone, directed him first to the street and called him afterwards to direct him as we drive. I thought that was wonderful. Needless to say that the hotel is very new and the rooms are cozy, fully equipped like all top 5* chains. If you pay a little extra you get to the business floor where you have a great lounge and a magnificent view. It might worth to pay a little extra to have the sea view rooms too. The bar is fun at night with many nationalities enjoying drinks and live music. The fitness center is good and the Hamam is luxurious great! The only small downside was the complexity of the taxi driver to choose the right turn when coming back to the hotel. You might want to take the map and instructions in Turkish from the concierge before you leave the hotel with a taxi to simplify coming back. Bottom line: If you are looking for the best value for money on the Asian side of Istanbul, with genuine outstanding Turkish hospitality , Divan is the hotel you want to stay in. They give the big chains a run for their money.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful, so far away...”
Reviews.Author: Carlo S
Reviews.Content: It was a test staying on Asian side because of landing at Sabiha Gokcen airport and other business related reasons. Hotel is nice, wellcome warm, we had a corner executive room with sea view. Room was high quality, space, clean, view and bathroom gorgeous wide and well equipped. Executive breakfast included and served at roof top lounge was good to start a long day. From the airport to the Hotel takes few minutes, and some 20 TL (around 10 Euro) on a speedy ride. On the other hand hotel is nowhere, except for the airport and although adress says Pendik it si actually in Tuzla, further southeast. We had a reasonable although expensive dinner nicely served on the rooftop restaurant, food has European price and is accurate, wine is unaffordable (level 80-120 TL for bottle, recently the current price at Istanbul restaurants though) There is nowhere at all to go from the hotel unless taking a taxi. Istanbul asian side traffic was horrible either on a rainy friday (one hour and 40 TL t oreach Marriot in Bostanci..!!:!:) either on next day saturday going to the pier of Kadikoy to reach via Eminonu Sultanhammet area. We took more than an hour to the ferry pier (!:!:) and a proportional bill. Finally: hotel is nice, even beautiful and chic but location is a non sense unless yo uare on the way from or to Sabiha Gokcen ariport. It is expensive although I would rate it fairly worth for your money. Friendly staff and willing to help, as is the general ruel in Turkey. Ah, forgot, chocolate from Divan is a real must (they have shop in the lobby) and a not to be missed buying.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been for a long time”
Reviews.Author: Doro64
Reviews.Content: Very elegant and stylish hotel with spacious rooms with wonderful seeview to Marama sea. Incredible helpful and friendly staff, very good restaurant. Very close to airport Sabiha GÃ¶kcen, but too far away from touristic hightlights of Istanbul Very good for business meetings and to stay at Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT...ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: AND_CHR
Reviews.Content: We were for business in the asian side of Istanbul and the location of the Divan is perfect for this. We were very pleased with this hotel. Clean, quiet, elegant ( for real 5* hotel) good staff, good breakfast, the room was beautiful ( sea view corner room). ONLY ONE WORD...PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Airport”
Reviews.Author: ajp066
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to Sabiha Gokcen airport and this place more than fitted the bill. Great facilities and fantastic views from the roof terrace. The room was marvellous and whilst it is clearly not close to the sights for a place to stay the night between flights it can't be faulted. Two swimming pools and a spa to boot. From the look of the airport hotel and the other hotels in the area it wins hands down.

Reviews.Title: “High-end choice if you have to be in that area”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: The Divan Asia belongs to one of Turkey's old families: Koc. It is an experiment to try to bring "luxury" into a remote area of Istanbul that offers no aesthetic surrounding whatsoever. We were at the Divan Asia for the Formula 1 Grand Prix, because of its proximity to the Racetrack. Some of the top-VIPs of F1 stayed at the hotel during the same time. The proximity to Sabiha GÃ¶kcen Airport may also bring business to the hotel, but there are other options like the Airport Hotel itself. The roof terrace of the Divan Asia is probably its nicest feature. In the future, I'd rather stay in a hotel in Istanbul proper.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly staff, but the location?”
Reviews.Author: drhako
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel for my daughter's birthday past weekend. The hotel was new. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were filling, varied and delicious. Our room was huge ( corner room). I was warm, clean and tidy with a comfortable bed and a fantastic decoration. The bathroom was very clean with a big marble bathtub and shower. Also there was a big shoping mall near hotel. The location was the only minus for choosing this hotel. If you want to stay Asian side of Istanbul close to SAW (Sabiha Gokcen Airport) this hotel is for you. Would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Divan Istanbul Asia
HotelInfo.Address: E5 Karayolu Uzeri No:209 | Ust Kaynarca Pendik, Istanbul 34899, Turkey
